subs.text:
RLF: How to approach impossible problem?

Step 2: Solve simpler problem
Step 3: Add back what was ignored to get improved result

subs.text:
RLF:
1. Regularize to make rectangular grid
2. Align columns based on content
3. Key cells in each row based on column alignment
4. Compare table rows using column alignment
4. Restore spans based on B priority

subs.text:
EBB: Gothenburg model of computer-aided collation
1. Tokenization (Smallest unit of comparison)
2. Normalization (e.g. & = and)
3. Alignment (chunking, identifiable start/end pts)]
4. Analysis
5. Visualization
Iterate
